intro: Dryandra lepidorhiza, commonly known as the red-stemmed dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow leaves and showy, pinkish-red floral clusters. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to the dry, Mediterranean climate of its native region. Its flowers bloom in late winter to early spring, attracting native pollinators such as birds and insects. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
